resources.string: You must enter a password of between 1 and 16 characters to be able to encrypt the data.

The key does not correspond to the encrypted message.
Press the BACK button again to exit the application.
Are you sure you want to delete the current clipboard? The encrypted / decrypted content that you have generated will be deleted and cannot be recovered if you have not previously copied it.
You must generate an output to share the result.
You must enter a valid RSA key.
The key can only have letters.
There was a problem creating the message.
Hi Miguel Romeral! I have tested your application and I would like to send you a suggestion for future versions:\n\n
Because the beautiful thing is inside ... \nYou can see the content of the project on GitHub by clicking on the following button:
Must include a hash to compare.
File name to export the key:

This encryption method is in testing. At this time it is NOT POSSIBLE REUSE THE KEYS, so you SHOULD NOT ENCRYPT sensitive content with this method (unless You are in the same session without closing the application. \nSorry for the inconvenience.

You can use your public or private key by clicking on any of the buttons that are just under this button. If you want to use a different key, you must have the file with the key in the /INTERNAL_STORAGE/Android/data/es.uah.edu.miguelangelgarciar.mraes/files/Documents/ folder. Then, in the text of the key, enter the name of the file and you can use it. \nTo export our public key, enter the name of the file in the text box below and click on EXPORT MY PUBLIC KEY
The text is too long to be encrypted..

Could not load that public key of another user. Enter the name of the file belonging to the public key of the other user with whom you want to operate. It must be stored in /INTERNAL_STORAGE/Android/data/es.uah.edu.miguelangelgarciar.mraes/files/Documents/.
You must enter a file name to export the public key.
We will create a new RSA key for this phone.
We could not create an RSA key for this phone.
If you enter a single letter as a key, you could convert Vigenere encryption to César encryption (although it is much less secure).
The message contains numbers and special characters (such as accents or eñes). THESE CHARACTERS WILL NOT BE ENCRYPTED.
Why don\'t you try to keep deleting the output?
Hey hey hey! Do you want to make sure that you have deleted the content, eh?

Well, now I have another secret for you, clever. Let\'s see if you are able to guess the password to be able to decipher this secret message that I leave to the curious person who has found this secret activity
PD: remember that you can return by pressing 7 times in a row with 5 seconds maximum difference on the DELETE OUTPUT button in AES
Are you sure you want to generate a new key? If you have encrypted data with a different key you could not decrypt it With the new one. It is recommended to save the previous password.
You need to enter a password in Base64.
There was a problem that we cannot redirect to the video. Sorry for the inconvenience.

Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), also known as Rijndael (pronounced "Rain Doll" in English), is a block encryption scheme adopted as a Encryption standard by the United States government. The AES was announced by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) as FIPS PUB 197 of the States United (FIPS 197) on November 26, 2001 after a standardization process that It lasted 5 years. It became an effective standard on May 26, 2002. Since 2006, AES is one of the most popular algorithms used in symmetric cryptography.

To encrypt in AES, you must enter a maximum password 16 characters, since the key must have 128 bits of key. The missing bytes in the key They will be filled with spaces. After entering a password, you must write any message and click on the ENCRYPT / DESCIRATE button to transform the data.
There is currently a new version of mrCiphER =. Do you want to install it at this time? IMPORTANT: You must have the option "Unknown sources" activated in the phone settings on applications.
An error occurred while trying to update the application. We apologize for the inconveniences.
You now have the latest version of the application! We will automatically check if they exist updates without you having to worry.
The text string entered is not in base 64. The conversion could not be performed

========================================

 	 Version 2.0 
 
 - Official launch on Google Play. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.7.4 (beta) 
 
 - Changes in the user interface (Source). 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.7.3 (beta) 
 
 - Fixed small bugs in AES. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.7.2 (beta) 
 
 - You can now export public keys in RSA and use imported keys. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.7.1 (beta) 
 
 - Direct access to the GitHub project. 
 - Created a tool to pass strings for Base64 to hexadecimal. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.7 (beta) 
 
 - Check for updates of the application automatically (when starting the application several times) and manually (in the menu). 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.6.2 (beta) 
 
 - Changed the source of the application. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.6.1 (beta) 
 
 - Added information about the AES algorithm. 
 - RSA keys are already persistent. It is not yet possible to operate with another user's public key (to get the most out of it to asymmetric cryptography). 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.6 (beta) 
 
 - Added secure DES (3DES in ede mode). 
 - Added Vigenere encryption (with a single letter key, Cesar encryption is achieved). 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.5.2 (beta) 
 
 - Added the other missing Hash algorithms such as SHA-224 or SHA-1. 
 - Modifications in the interface and restructuring of the application. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.5.1 (beta) 
 
 - Fixed performance issues at application startup. 
 - Included a button in the "About" activity where you can send suggestions to the developer. - Changes in the interface: routine buttons with symbols instead of such long texts. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.5 (beta) 
 
 - Implemented encryption with DES. 
 - Passwords in AES and DES are saved 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.4 (beta) 
 
 - Implemented encryption with RSA but with non-reusable keys. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.3.1 (beta) 
 
 - Added a little secret;) Let's see who deciphers it. 
 - Including an activity with the news in each version. 
 - Including tabs for future features (although not shown). 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.3.0 (beta) 
 
 - Including an "About" activity with information about the developer. 
 - Changed the structure of the App to fragments (better access to functionalities). 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.2.1 (beta) 
 
 - Button to share the cipher output (call to the operating system). 
 - Added functionality to compare hashes between them. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.2.0 (beta) 
 
 - Added functionality to generate hashes in SHA512 and MD5 (including salt) and options on them. - Button to erase the cipher output. 
 - Button to erase the contents of the clipboard. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.1.2 (beta) 
 
 - Changed interface look to black and blue (including logo). 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.1.0 (beta) 
 
 - Added buttons to improve copying / pasting of encryption. 
 
 ======================================== 
 
 	 Version 1.0.0 (beta) 
 
 - Functionality tested. 
 - First version of the 128-bit AES cipher. 
 
 ========================================
